intro: Chorisepalum psychotrioides var. acuminatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Psychotria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often followed by small, round berries. It is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories, where it thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil.
